episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including a computer game that takes more than a lifetime to complete, the absence of Loch Ness monster sightings in 2013, Madame Tussaud's grim beginnings during the French Revolution, and the use of parachute dogs during the Normandy landings in World War II.

facts.fact: A computer game has been invented that takes more than a lifetime to complete.
2013 was the first year since 1933 that there hasn't been a sighting of the Loch Ness monster.
The French government forced Madame Tussaud to make models of her friends' decapitated heads.
During the Normandy landings, the Allied forces dropped dogs by parachute.
